Sentencas: Cation diffusion was investigated in La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-delta (LSC) thin films on (100) yttria stabilized zirconia in the temperature range 625-800 degrees C. Isotopic (86Sr) and elemental tracers (Fe, Sm) were used to establish diffusion profiles of the cations in bi- and multi-layered thin films.
Titulo: Cation diffusion in La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ below 800 °C and its relevance for Sr segregation

Sentencas: The profiles were analyzed by time of flight-secondary ion mass spectrometry (ToF-SIMS).
Titulo: Cation diffusion in La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ below 800 °C and its relevance for Sr segregation

Sentencas: Grain and grain boundary diffusion coefficients of the cations were determined for LSC thin films with columnar grains - diffusion along grain boundaries is shown to be about three orders of magnitude faster than in grains.
Titulo: Cation diffusion in La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ below 800 °C and its relevance for Sr segregation

Sentencas: This could be verified for thin films with different grain size.
Titulo: Cation diffusion in La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ below 800 °C and its relevance for Sr segregation

Sentencas: A- and B-site cations showed very similar temperature dependencies with activation energies of similar to 3.5 eV for bulk and similar to 4.1 eV for grain boundary diffusion.
Titulo: Cation diffusion in La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ below 800 °C and its relevance for Sr segregation

Sentencas: The importance of cation diffusivities for surface segregation of Sr and thus for a major degradation mechanism of LSC cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells is discussed.
Titulo: Cation diffusion in La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ below 800 °C and its relevance for Sr segregation
